ratings.comment: Considering I am highly interested in South Asian economics and politics, I was impressed that Aseema managed to make me so bored and frustrated in this class. Her notes were scattered and she insisted on students teaching the readings rather than doing so herself. She also didn't stick to her syllabus, added three assignments during the semester.

Makes a really interesting subject dull.  She sucks all the life out of social movements.  Focuses exclusively on women's movements and movts in India.  Doesn't provide a clear review of either theory or particular cases.  Really tough to follow, mostly because lecture is so dry and uninspired.  2nd half of course was really reading intensive.

She might just be the worst professor I've ever had.  She comes to lecture disorganized, insists on lecturing off the readings and contributes very little to discussion.  If I wanted that, I would have taken a discussion led by a TA. Her class might be easy but it's not worth it for all the bs you have to deal with to get your A.

She's really knows her stuff and can seem uptight but she's pretty nice.  Her lecture notes are not clear at all.  Doesn't give good review of the readings but the class discussions and presentation do help a lot.  There is lots of material but she's a pretty easy grader.

Awful professor. Very boring and hard to understand. She removes her overheads before you can write down everything. She focuses the whole class on India but not her exams. The exams are written and then graded very hard. Don't take her!

Most unorganized, difficult to interpret lecture I've had thus far. I recommend finding a good TA and skipping every lecture you hesitate to attend. Videos....pointless and the tests are not difficult if you read and go to section.

Aseema is really smart and knows what she's talking about, but doesn't know how to give a lecture on it. The tests are pretty easy if you do the readings, but she's probably one of the worse professors I've had.
its difficult to understand her because she doesnt speak english very well

You can tell she's probably a decent political scientist, but it doesn't really show in her lectures. Her overheads don't have any logical flow to them, and they seem to skirt the issues she is trying to present rather than say them outright. I agree, though, the TAs are very helpful and the tests decent. I recommend Richter for TA.

No logic behind her lectures... jumps from different dates to different countries really fast. Her overhead outlines don't make sense and always end in a question. Take the class, but avoid the professor.

Her lectures are AWFUL. Skips around all the time and she asks questions to the class and gets extremely angry if no one will answer.  Luckily, the T.A.'s are all AWESOME and should be teaching the class so they clarified the lectures in discussion and then it helped on the tests which weren't that bad.
